intro: Empedoclia montana, commonly known as the mountain empedoclia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a strong, distinctive odor. Empedoclia montana is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
